item.title: Birdsell Groarke
item.description: One Liner Visual arguments are of a different type, argue person into a “state of feeling.” Summary Assemble a theory of visual argumentation that is different from verbal persuasion. It expands the typical notions and troubles what have been the traditional distinctions between persuasion and argument. In building their theory of visual argument, the refute arguments that visuals cannot be arguments, and illustrate how visuals can be not only persuasive, and arguments.
